block.p: Carolyn Grace Bernstein, a daughter of Doris and William Bernstein of New York, was married yesterday to Nicholas Newfield Grad, the son of Laurie Burrows Grad and Peter Grad of Los Angeles. Rabbi Steven Carr Reuben performed the ceremony at Shutters on the Beach, a hotel in Santa Monica, Calif.

Ms. Bernstein, 32, is keeping her name. She is a senior vice president for programming at the WB Television Network in Los Angeles. She graduated magna cum laude from Brown University. Her father is a lawyer in New York. The bride's paternal grandfather, the late Sam Bernstein, was a co-owner of Murray's Sturgeon Shop in New York.

Ms. Bernstein, 32, is keeping her name. She is a senior vice president for programming at the WB Television Network in Los Angeles. She graduated magna cum laude from Brown University. Her father is a lawyer in New York. The bride's paternal grandfather, the late Sam Bernstein, was a co-owner of Murray's Sturgeon Shop in New York.

Mr. Grad, 30, is the vice president for comedy development at Columbia TriStar Television in Los Angeles. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. His mother is a freelance food writer and cookbook author. His father, who retired as the president of MTM Television in Los Angeles, is an independent television writer and producer. The bridegroom is a grandson of the late Abe Burrows, the writer and director who was a co-author of the books for ''Guys and Dolls,'' ''How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying'' and other Broadway shows.

The couple met in 1997 when they were both working at Columbia TriStar. Their first date was at the wedding of the bridegroom's uncle James Burrows, a television director and producer who was a co-creator of ''Cheers.''
